==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|せ|わ|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
Believed to derive from {{m|ja|忙しい||busy|tr=sewashii}}. The kanji are ateji.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|せわ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|ja|お世話|tr=おせわ, osewa}}, {{l|ja|御世話|tr=おせわ, osewa}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|せわ}}

# [[care]], looking after, [[help]], [[favor]]
#: {{ja-usex|お'''世話'''になりました。|^お'''せわ''' に なりました。|Literally, “I have been taken care of.” → “Thank you very much for everything.” / “I'm very obliged to you (for what you've done).”}}

====Usage notes====
Takes the formal prefix {{m|ja|お|tr=o-}} when talking to someone outside the group (which could be ''anyone else'' when the “group” is just oneself) about a favor done for someone inside the group.

====Idioms====
* {{ja-r|世話をする|せわ を する}}: to take care of, to do a favor
* {{ja-r|世話になる|せわ に なる}}: to receive a favor, to be obliged or indebted to someone {{qualifier|for taking care of something}}
* {{ja-r|お世話になる|おせわ に なる}}
